t: Luke 5
Four Fishermen Called as Disciples
So*p it was, as the multitude pressed about Him to hear the word of God, that He stood by the Lake of Gennesaret,
and saw two boats standing by the lake; but the fishermen had gone from them and were washing their*i nets.
Then He got into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little from the land. And He sat down and taught the multitudes from the boat.
When*p He had stopped speaking, He said to Simon, “Launch*r out*r into*r the*r deep*r and*r let*r down*r your*r nets*r for*r a*r catch.”*r
But*p Simon answered and said to Him, “Master, we have toiled all night and caught nothing; nevertheless at Your word I will let down the net.”
And when they had done this, they caught a great number of fish, and their net was breaking.
So they signaled to their*i partners in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both the boats, so that they began to sink.
When Simon Peter saw it,*i he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, O Lord!”
For*p he and all who were with him were astonished at the catch of fish which they had taken;
and so also were*i James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. And Jesus said to Simon, “Do*r not*r be*r afraid.*r From*r now*r on*r you*r will*r catch*r men.”*r
So when they had brought their boats to land, they forsook all and followed Him.
Jesus Cleanses a Leper

And*p it happened when He was in a certain city, that behold, a man who was full of leprosy saw Jesus; and he fell on his*i face and implored Him, saying, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”
Then*p He put out His*i hand and touched him, saying, “I*r am*r willing;*r be*r cleansed.”*r Immediately the leprosy left him.

And He charged him to tell no one, “But*r go*r and*r show*r yourself*r to*r the*r priest,*r and*r make*r an*r offering*r for*r your*r cleansing,*r as*r a*r testimony*r to*r them,*r just*r as*r Moses*r commanded.”*r
However,*p the report went around concerning Him all the more; and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by Him of their infirmities.
So He Himself often*i withdrew into the wilderness and prayed.
Jesus Forgives and Heals a Paralytic

Now*p it happened on a certain day, as He was teaching, that there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting by, who had come out of every town of Galilee, Judea, and Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was present*i to heal them.
Then behold, men brought on a bed a man who was paralyzed, whom they sought to bring in and lay before Him.
And when they could not find how they might bring him in, because of the crowd, they went up on the housetop and let him down with his*i bed through the tiling into the midst before Jesus.
When*p He saw their faith, He said to him, “Man,*r your*r sins*r are*r forgiven*r you.”*r
And*p the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
But*p when Jesus perceived their thoughts, He answered and said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r reasoning*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
Which*r is*r easier,*r to*r say,*r ‘Your*r sins*r are*r forgiven*r you,’*r or*r to*r say,*r ‘Rise*r up*r and*r walk’?*r

But*r that*r you*r may*r know*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r power*r on*r earth*r to*r forgive*r sins”*r —He said to the man who was paralyzed, “I*r say*r to*r you,*r arise,*r take*r up*r your*r bed,*r and*r go*r to*r your*r house.”*r
Immediately*p he rose up before them, took up what he had been lying on, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.
And they were all amazed, and they glorified God and were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen strange things today!”
Matthew the Tax Collector
After*p these things He went out and saw a tax collector named Levi, sitting at the tax office. And He said to him, “Follow*r Me.”*r
So he left all, rose up, and followed Him.
Then*p Levi gave Him a great feast in his own house. And there were a great number of tax collectors and others who sat down with them.
And their scribes and the Pharisees complained against His disciples, saying, “Why do You eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
Jesus*p answered and said to them, “Those*r who*r are*r well*r have*r no*r need*r of*r a*r physician,*r but*r those*r who*r are*r sick.*r
I*r have*r not*r come*r to*r call*r the*ir righteous,*r but*r sinners,*r to*r repentance.”*r
Jesus Is Questioned About Fasting
Then*p they said to Him, “Why do the disciples of John fast often and make prayers, and likewise those of the Pharisees, but Yours eat and drink?”
And*p He said to them, “Can*r you*r make*r the*r friends*r of*r the*r bridegroom*r fast*r while*r the*r bridegroom*r is*r with*r them?*r
But*r the*r days*r will*r come*r when*r the*r bridegroom*r will*r be*r taken*r away*r from*r them;*r then*r they*r will*r fast*r in*r those*r days.”*r

Then*p He spoke a parable to them: “No*r one*r puts*r a*r piece*r from*r a*r new*r garment*r on*r an*r old*r one;*r otherwise*r the*r new*r makes*r a*r tear,*r and*r also*r the*r piece*r that*r was*r taken*ir out*r of*r the*r new*r does*r not*r match*r the*r old.*r
And*r no*r one*r puts*r new*r wine*r into*r old*r wineskins;*r or*r else*r the*r new*r wine*r will*r burst*r the*r wineskins*r and*r be*r spilled,*r and*r the*r wineskins*r will*r be*r ruined.*r
But*r new*r wine*r must*r be*r put*r into*r new*r wineskins,*r and*r both*r are*r preserved.*r
And*r no*r one,*r having*r drunk*r old*r wine,*ir immediately*r desires*r new;*r for*r he*r says,*r ‘The*r old*r is*r better.’”*r
